Requirement: The system must display a Main Menu component.
Reasoning: Foundation navigation to access core gameplay; low cost/risk makes it an ideal starting point.

Requirement: The Main Menu component must wait until the user selects a button.
Reasoning: Essential interaction behavior to enable progression; complements FR-006.

Requirement: The Main Menu must forward the user to game components.
Reasoning: Enables access to gameplay and external link; required before core value delivery.

Requirement: Display question and wait for answer.
Reasoning: Core interaction mechanic; prerequisite for delivering learning value.

Requirement: Success message and proceed to next question.
Reasoning: Delivers core feedback loop; low cost and risk.
Higher value gameplay mechanic; should follow base question workflow.
Highest value feature enabling learning goals; built on previous mechanics to mitigate risk.
High value and high risk; placed after core gameplay is stable.
Required for scoring in ending scenes; low risk.

Requirement: Direct to Ending Scene after question set.
Reasoning: Unlocks completion flow; depends on gameplay loop.
Delivers important feedback; built on FR-022.
Higher risk but meaningful value; placed after core and scoring logic.

Requirement: Exit or return to Main Menu.
Reasoning: Completes ending UX; low cost and risk.
Adds narrative value but not foundational; implemented after core gameplay paths.
Enhances UX; depends on FR-003.
Completes intro experience; low risk addition.

Requirement: Provide singular Math Umbrella component online.
Reasoning: Useful entry point but not required for initial playable flow; medium value.

Requirement: Open S2S product in separate window.
Reasoning: Lower value and higher risk; deprioritized to avoid early stability issues.
High value for maintainability but high risk; delivered after core gameplay complete.

Requirement: Generate server text file for dynamic loading.
Reasoning: Completes updater pipeline; delivered last to mitigate accumulated risk.
